DOC.brief_title: Leisure Expectations About Physical Activity Study
DOC.detailed_description: Consecutive patient , age 45 year old , schedule primary total hip knee arthroplasty due osteoarthritis randomize intervention control ( intervention ) group . All patient interview telephone prior intervention , interviewer blind group status , collect data current leisure activity expect activity 6 month surgery . Patients also complete questionnaire collect data sociodemographic characteristic , comorbidities ( American Academy Orthopaedic Surgeons Comorbidity Index ) , pain intensity ( 0-10 scale ) , health-related quality life ( SF-12 ) , hip-/knee-specific outcome ( Hip Dysfunction Osteoarthritis Outcome Score/Knee Injury Osteoarthritis Outcome Score ) , general expectation ( Hospital Special Surgery Total Hip/Knee Replacement Expectations Surveys ) , stage readiness change . All patient receive usual medical care surgery visit clinic meet surgeon nurse/physician assistant , undergo pre-operative laboratory test . Patients intervention group also meet member research team complete 10-item pre-test , ass knowledge key concept intervention , present 20-minute slide presentation . The presentation educate patient : 1 ) definition physical activity associate health benefit general population people arthritis , ( 2 ) 2008 Physical Activity Guidelines Americans , 3 ) appropriate type aerobic activity patient engage THA/TKA ( e.g. , no- low-impact activity ) , ( 4 ) appropriate intensity level activity THA/TKA ( e.g. , least moderate intensity ) , ( 5 ) appropriate duration participation activity ( e.g. , increment 10 minute ) , ( 6 ) appropriate amount activity per week ( e.g. , â‰¥ 2.5 hour [ 150 minute ] ) . Patients complete satisfaction survey provide feedback content , format , length intervention , post-test measure mastery intervention material . The post-test contain question pre-test , different order . The control group meet research team pre-operative visit . The control group receive write version intervention end study . All patient re-interviewed telephone one week visit reassess leisure activity expectation . Data analysis conduct determine : 1 ) direction magnitude change expect leisure activity baseline 6 month , 2 ) change proportion patient expect meet national physical activity guideline 6 month surgery , 3 ) whether intervention modify type , frequency , duration , intensity expect leisure activity pre- post-administration .
